div.head: Matthew Stone Will
div.p:
In the name of God Amen, this twenty fourth day of December anno 1672
I Matthew Stone of Charles County in the province of Maryland planter being sick of
body but of good and perfect memory thanks bee to God and calling to mind
the Estate of this transitory life and that all flesh must yield unto
Death
Death when it shall please God to call do make Constitute ordaine and
declare this to bee my last will and testament in manner and form
following First being pertinant and from the bottom of my heart
for my sens past humbly desiring forgiveness for the same I give and
Commit my soule unto Allmighty God my savior and redeemer in
whome by the merits of Jesus Christ Death and passion
profits and inherit the Kingdom of Heaven prepared for his Elect and
chosen amd my body to bee buried in such place where it shall please my
Executors hereafter named to appoint, and for the settleing of my temporal
Estate. I do order give disperse of the same in manner and form following
that is to say first I will that all those Debts which I owe in right or
Conocieve to any manner of person or persons whatsoever shall be well
and truly satisfied contented and paid in som Convenient time after my
desease by my Executor hereafter named.

Item. I give and bequeath to William Marshall Senior one gray horse
aged two years or there atouts likewise I give and bequeath unto William
Marshall Junior one cowe called Braunsing Likewise I give John Fereuly his only sonn of Francis Fereuly one cowe known and called by the name
of Ould Coale Likewise I give and bequeath unto Jonathan Marker one cowe
known & commonly called by the name young Coale. Item I give & bequeath unto
Elizabeth Cormichill one bat mare aged five years or the afords
likewise I give to the said Elizabeth Cormichill one young bay filly with a tan
in it forehead further I give to the said Elizabeth Cormichill one cow called
and by the name of black bird.
Item I give and bequeath one young heifer and three sterns for the use and behest of she Elizabeth Cormichill
I give also one cow at Thomas Bakers I purchase of him and all the and residence of my Estate whatsoever

I give and bequeath to Elizabeth Cormichill, likewise it is my will and desire
in this my last will and testament that William Marshall herein and
Jonathan Marlen whom I have chosen to be my true and lawful Executors of
this
This my last will and testament shall out to their utmost in the performance
thereof I witness whereof I have hereunto put my hand and seal this twenty fourth
day of december anno Dom. One thousand six hundred seventy two

Sealed and delivered
In the presents of
Mr. W Marshall & Jonathan Marlen
William Marshall Junior
his
Matthew X Stone
mark

Anexed to and on the back of the aforgoing was the following probate & endorsement to will
The >2 of April 1672. The above written last will and testament of Matthew Stone
was by the oaths of Mr Marshall Junior and Jonathan Marlen in common form
proved before me the day and year above written and further they made oaths that
the raisings & interlineation in the above said will was made before the said stone
Signed sealed and published the same
Robert Redgely clerk

The 2 of April 1672, Mr. William Marshall Senior and Jonathan Marley Charles
County appointed Executors of the last will and testament of Matthew Stone within
named doe hereby declare to all persons that we renounce the Executor of the same
to all intent and purpose whatsoever and will not intermend with the same
as hands seals the day and year above.

Sealed and Delivered
In the presents of us
Robert Ridgley
John Giggs
6 Â¼ sides
William Marshall
Jonathan Marlen
